page.title: 03A DAY IN THE LIFE OF PENTON
page.content: screeching and getting excited because they are just about to be fed. People will go out for and early walk with their dogs. Women take the milk bottles off the doorstep and pick the news paper up off the mat. After most people have had their breakfast the children start coming or going to school. Then people start revving up their cars and going off down the road to work. Next the{baker comes in his van to deliver freshly baked, warm bread and cakes. He brings a lovely smell. Soon lots of cars start arriving for the auction. They park anywhere they can find, on the grass by the village hall and the banks of Chalkcroft Lane. When you get near you can hear the hum of voices. Today the dustbins are out and soon the dirty noise of the{dustcart}will
